comments:
Created an attachment (id=83616)
report design

Description:
Exception is thrown out when binding chart to a data set with column bindings.

Build number: 
2.3.0.v20071123-0800

Steps to reproduce:
1. Double click to open the chart in the attached report design.
2. Switch to "Select Data" tab, Use Data Set "Data Set1"

Expected result:
Since column "ORDERDATE" and "ORDERNUMBER" are listed in "Data Explorer" View, no exception is thrown out.

Actual result:
Exception is thrown out.

Error log:
Column binding "ORDERDATE" has refered to a data set column "ORDERDATE" which does not exist.
The dataset can't work even if in dataset editor. It seems a DtE bug.
Re-assigning to data team for further investigation.

When you open the dataset editor, exception is thrown like this:
org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.core.DataException: Cannot convert the parameter value params["NewParameter"] to type class java.sql.Date.
Can not convert the value of params["NewParameter"] to java.sql.Date type.
at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.DataSourceQuery.convertToValue(DataSourceQuery.java:713)
at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.DataSourceQuery.addParameterDefns(DataSourceQuery.

And if you open the chart builder, like this:
org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.core.DataException: Column binding "ORDERDATE" has referred to a data set column "ORDERDATE" which does not exist.
	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.ResultIterator.validateManualBindingExpressions(ResultIterator.java:274)
	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.ResultIterator.<init>(ResultIterator.java:147)
	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.QueryResults.getResultIterator(QueryResults.java:182)
	at org.eclipse.birt.chart.reportitem.ui.ReportDataServiceProvider.getPreviewRowData(ReportDataServiceProvider.java:193)

Anyway, this dataset with script produces the exception from DtE.

User should be reponsible for the consistency of result set metadata. In this report, user change the query text in beforeOpen script, but also change the main resultset schema of this dataset. So caused this error.

traces.message: Cannot convert the parameter value params["NewParameter"] to type class java.sql.Date. Can not convert the value of params["NewParameter"] to java.sql.Date type.
Column binding "ORDERDATE" has referred to a data set column "ORDERDATE" which does not exist.
